author: Special Correspondent
text:
Though the mortal remains of nine of the ten soldiers who were killed in the avalanche that hit the Siachen glacier area on February 3 were flown to the Siachen base camp on Saturday, they could not be moved further to Leh “due to bad weather,” official sources said.

“Efforts [are] being taken to transport the mortal remains of our martyrs to Delhi and further to their home town,” an official release from the Defence Ministry stated.

Four from

Tamil Nadu

Four of the soldiers found dead were from Tamil Nadu.

Lance Naik Hanumanthappa, who was found alive, died eventually at the Army Research and Referral Hospital in Delhi on Thursday.

All of them were attached to the 19th battalion of the Madras Regiment.
title: Weather hinders shifting of soldiers’ remains
